Burma: Burmese armies withdrawn from Siam and redeployed to the Chinese front. Burmese defenses against the Chinese invasions held. Siam recaptures all of its territories (except Tenasserim) (to 1770)
France: Treaty of Versailles: In order to pay its debts and being no longer able to suppress struggle for independence, the Republic of Genoa ceded Corsica to France. Corsica remained French ever since.
Nepal: Gorkha ruler Prithvi Narayan Shah conquers Kathmandu and lays foundations for unified kingdom.
Russia: Repnin Sejm: Delegates of the Sejm adopted a treaty ensuring future Russian influence in Polish internal politics.
Polish nobles established the Bar Confederation in order to end Russian influence in their country.
Russo-Turkish War (1768–1774): The Ottoman sultan declared war on Russia.
Sweden: The December Crisis (1768) fails to increase royal power.
